page.title: 02Maun continued
page.content: He said that the Maun now supplied water for irrigation using pumps.The local council water board confirmed this and said that a number of farmers had licenses to do this. The council also told us that the sewage from Sutton and Mansfield works was discharged into the river as well as waste from the collieries.We were told that 60-70% of the water in dry weather was treated effluent,but that from Edwinstowe onwards it was much healthier.This meant that fish could could live in it but might have trouble breeding.We had several talks with local fishermen,farmers,and walkers and the same picture emerged. One local fisherman told us of 30lb carp and 10lb tench in the dykes,but didn't bother with the river.A local farmer told of seeing a kingfisher regularly on the Maun so we thought
